lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/TobyBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run TobyBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here

Welcome to the **TobyBot** User Guide! TobyBot is a task management chatbot designed to help you manage your to-do list, deadlines, and events efficiently. Below is a guide to help you use all the important features of TobyBot.
To add a simple to-do task, use the `todo` command followed by the task description.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
To add a task with a deadline, use the `deadline` command followed by the task description and due date. You need to separate the task description and due date with the keyword `by`.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
* Parses user input and returns the appropriate command.
* Parses the user's input command and creates a corresponding Command object.
* @param fullCommand The full command input by the user.
* @return A Command object that represents the user's command.
* @throws TobyBotException If the command is invalid or unrecognized.
public static Command parse(String fullCommand) throws TobyBotException {
// Check if the user has provided a task number
throw new TobyBotException("Please provide a task number to mark.");
// Check if the user has provided a task number
throw new TobyBotException("Please provide a task number to unmark.");
// Check if the user has provided a description for the todo
throw new TobyBotException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
// Check if the user has provided details for the deadline
throw new TobyBotException("The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
// Check if the user has provided details for the event
throw new TobyBotException("The description of an event cannot be empty.");
// Check if the user has provided a task number to delete
throw new TobyBotException("Please provide a task number to delete.");
// Check if the user has provided a keyword to search
throw new TobyBotException("Please provide a keyword to search for.");
* Handles loading and saving tasks to a file.
* @param filePath The file path for saving and loading tasks.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
* Saves a list of tasks to a file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to save.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs.
public void save(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws IOException {
* Converts a task to a string format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representation of the task for file storage.
* Represents the main class for TobyBot, a task management bot.
* @param filePath The file path to load and save tasks.
* Runs the TobyBot, allowing the user to interact with it.
* Custom exception for errors specific to TobyBot.
* Handles user interaction, such as displaying messages and reading commands.
* Displays the welcome message to the user.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Reads a command from the user.
* @return The user's command as a string.
* Displays a separator line in the console.
* Displays an error message for loading tasks.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Command to add a new task (either a Todo, Deadline, or Event) to the task list.
* @param type    The type of task to add (todo, deadline, or event).
* @param details The description and other details of the task.
* Executes the add command by creating the appropriate task and adding it to the task list.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to add the new task to.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save the updated tasks.
* @throws TobyBotException If the task type or details are invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TobyBotException {
if (details.isEmpty()) throw new TobyBotException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
if (deadlineParts.length < 2) throw new TobyBotException("Please specify a deadline with by.");
if (eventParts.length < 3) throw new TobyBotException("Please specify an event with from and to.");
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + task);
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Abstract class representing a command that can be executed by TobyBot.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to operate on.
* @param ui      The user interface to handle messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save/load tasks.
* @throws TobyBotException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TobyBotException;
* Indicates whether the command is an exit command.
* @return true if the command is an exit command, false otherwise.
* Command to delete a task from the task list based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted (1-based index).
* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the specified index.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks from which a task is removed.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save the updated tasks.
* @throws TobyBotException If the index is out of bounds or the task cannot be removed.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TobyBotException {
ui.showMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n  " + tasks.removeTask(index));
ui.showMessage("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Executes the exit command by displaying a goodbye message.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks (not used in this command).
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Indicates that this command will terminate the application.
* @return true, indicating that the application should exit.
* Command to find tasks that match a given keyword in their description.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in tasks.
* Executes the find command, searching for tasks that contain the keyword.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to search.
* @param ui      The user interface to display results.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used here).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Command to list all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to display.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Command to mark a task as done based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done (1-based index).
* Executes the mark command by marking the task at the specified index as done.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to mark a task as done.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save the updated tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + tasks.getTask(index));
* Command to unmark a task (mark it as not done) based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked (1-based index).
* Executes the unmark command by marking the task at the specified index as not done.
* @param tasks   The list of tasks to unmark a task.
* @param ui      The user interface to display messages.
* @param storage The storage handler to save the updated tasks.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + tasks.getTask(index));
* Represents a task with a deadline.

* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* @return A string in the format "[D][X] description (by: dueDate)".
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param startTime   The start time of the event.
* @param endTime     The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {

* Gets the end time of the event.

* @return A string in the format "[E][X] description (from: startTime to: endTime)".
